original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

original: Tena kho pana samayena therā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ovadanti pariyāyena. Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato cūḷapanthakassa pariyāyo hoti bhikkhuniyo ovadituṁ.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena therāḥ bhikkhū bhikkhuniyaḥ ovadanti pariyāyena tena kho pana samayena āyasmataḥ cūḷapanthakassa pariyāyaḥ hoti bhikkhuniyaḥ ovaditu
translated: On one occasion the senior monks were taking turns to advise the nuns. On that occasion it was the turn of Venerable Cūḷapanthaka.

original: Bhikkhuniyo evamāhaṁsu—“na dāni ajja ovādo iddho bhavissati, taññeva dāni udānaṁ ayyo cūḷapanthako punappunaṁ bhaṇissatī”ti.
analyzed: bhikkhuniyaḥ evam āha suna dāni ajja ovādaḥ iddhaḥ bhavissati taññeva dāni udānam ayyo cūḷa panthako punappunam bhaṇissati iti
translated: The nuns said, “Today the advice won’t be effective. Venerable Cūḷapanthaka will just keep repeating the same thing over and over.”

original: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo yenāyasmā cūḷapanthako tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ cūḷapanthakaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
analyzed: atha kho tāḥ bhikkhuniyaḥ yena āyasmā cūḷa panthakaḥ tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam cūḷa panthakam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdisu
translated: They then went to Cūḷapanthaka, bowed, and sat down.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnā kho tā bhikkhuniyo āyasmā cūḷapanthako etadavoca—“samaggāttha, bhaginiyo”ti?
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnāḥ kho tāḥ bhikkhuniyaḥ āyasmā cūḍapanthako etat avoca samaggā attha bhaginiyaḥ iti
translated: Cūḷapanthaka said to them, “Are you all here, Sisters?”
“We’re all here, Venerable.”

analyzed: vattanti bhaginiyaḥ aṭṭha garu dhammā ati
translated: “Are the eight important principles being observed?”
“They are, Venerable.”

original: “Eso, bhaginiyo, ovādo”ti niyyādetvā imaṁ udānaṁ punappunaṁ abhāsi—
translated: “This is the instruction.” And he repeated the verse again and again.
“For those with a superior mind, who are heedful,
who train in the way of the one who is free,
there is no sorrow,
for those who are peaceful, always mindful.”

original: Bhikkhuniyo evamāhaṁsu—“nanu avocumhā—na dāni ajja ovādo iddho bhavissati, taññeva dāni udānaṁ ayyo cūḷapanthako punappunaṁ bhaṇissatī”ti.
analyzed: bhikkhuniyaḥ evam āhasu nanu avocumhāna dāni ajja ovādaḥ iddho bhavissati taññeva dāni udānam ayyo cūḷa panthako punappunam bhaṇissati iti
translated: The nuns said, “We said that the instruction would not be successful today, and that Venerable Cūḷapanthaka would just repeat that verse again and again.”

original: Assosi kho āyasmā cūḷapanthako tāsaṁ bhikkhunīnaṁ imaṁ kathāsallāpaṁ.
analyzed: assosi kho āyasmā cūḷapanthako tāsam bhikkhunīnam imam kathā sallāpa
translated: Venerable Cūḷapanthaka heard their conversation.

original: Atha kho āyasmā cūḷapanthako vehāsaṁ abbhuggantvā ākāse antalikkhe caṅkamatipi tiṭṭhatipi🔽nisīdatipi seyyampi kappeti dhūmāyatipi pajjalatipi antaradhāyatipi, tañceva udānaṁ
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā cūḷa panthakaḥ vehāsam abbhuggantvā ākāse antalikkhe caṅkamati pi tiṭṭhati pi  nisīdati pi seyyampi kappeti dhūmāyati pi pajjalati antaradhāyati tat ca iva udāna
translated: He then rose up into the air, and while walking, standing, sitting, and lying down in the sky,
he emitted smoke and flames, and he disappeared and reappeared. And he recited that verse and much other Buddha-word.
The nuns said,

analyzed: acchariyam vata bho abbhutam vata bho
translated: “It’s astonishing and amazing

original: Na vata no ito pubbe ovādo evaṁ iddho bhūtapubbo yathā ayyassa cūḷapanthakassā”ti.
analyzed: na vata naḥ itas pubbe ovādaḥ evam iddhaḥ bhūta pubbaḥ yathā ayyassa cūḷa panthakassa ati
translated: that the instruction of Venerable Cūḷapanthaka is so powerful and mighty.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā cūḷapanthako tā bhikkhuniyo yāva samandhakārā ovaditvā uyyojesi—“gacchatha, bhaginiyo”ti.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā cūḷapanthako tāḥ bhikkhuniyaḥ yāva samandhakārāḥ ovaditvā uyyojesi gacchatha bhaginiyo ti
translated: After instructing those nuns for the whole night, he dismissed them, saying, “Go, Sisters.”

original: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo nagaradvāre thakite bahinagare vasitvā kālasseva nagaraṁ pavisanti.
analyzed: atha kho tāḥ bhikkhuniyaḥ nagara dvāre thakite bahi nagare vasitvā kālassa iva nagaram pavisanti
translated: But because the city gates had been closed, they stayed outside the city. And because it was still dark, they entered the city early in the morning.

original: Manussā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—“abrahmacāriniyo imā bhikkhuniyo;
analyzed: manussāḥ ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti abrahmacāriniyaḥ imāḥ bhikkhuniyaḥ
translated: People complained and criticized them, “These nuns are not celibate.

original: ārāme bhikkhūhi saddhiṁ vasitvā idāni nagaraṁ pavisantī”ti.
analyzed: ārāme bhikkhūhi saddhim vasitvā idāni nagaram pavisanti iti
translated: They’ve stayed in the monastery with the monks and are now entering the city.”

original: Assosuṁ kho bhikkhū tesaṁ manussānaṁ ujjhāyantānaṁ khiyyantānaṁ vipācentānaṁ.
analyzed: assosum kho bhikkhū tesam manussānam ujjhāyantānam khiyyantānam vipācentāna
translated: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

original: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū appicchā pe te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized him,🔽“How could Venerable Cūḷapanthaka instruct the nuns after sunset?” …

original: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā cūḷapanthako atthaṅgate sūriye bhikkhuniyo ovadissatī”ti …pe…
analyzed: katham hi nāma āyasmā cūḷapanthakaḥ atthaṅgate sūriye bhikkhuniyaḥ ovadissati iti pe
translated: “How could the monk Cūḷapanthaka instruct the nuns after sunset?” …

original: “saccaṁ kira tvaṁ, cūḷapanthaka, atthaṅgate sūriye bhikkhuniyo ovadasī”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira tva cūḷa panthaka atthaṅgate sūriye bhikkhuniyaḥ ovadasi iti
translated: “Is it true, Cūḷapanthaka, that you did this?”
“It’s true, Sir.”
The Buddha rebuked him …

original: kathañhi nāma tvaṁ, cūḷapanthaka, atthaṅgate sūriye bhikkhuniyo ovadissasi.
analyzed: katham hi nāma tva cūḷa panthaka atthaṅgate sūriye bhikkhuniyaḥ ovadissasi
translated: “Cūḷapanthaka, how could you do this?

analyzed: na ita cūḷapanthaka appasannānam vā pasādāya pe
translated: This is not conducive to confidence in those without it …

original: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ uddiseyyātha—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave imam sikkhāpadam uddiseyyātha
translated: And, monks, this is how you should recite this training rule:

original: “Sammatopi ce bhikkhu atthaṅgate sūriye bhikkhuniyo ovadeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
analyzed: sammataḥ api ce bhikkhu atthaṅgate sūriye bhikkhuniyaḥ ovadeyya pācittiyanti
translated: ‘If a monk gives a teaching to the nuns after sunset, even if agreed upon, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
Agreed upon:
appointed by means of a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements.
After sunset:
when the sun has set.
A nun:
one who has been fully admitted according to the Dharma.
Gives a teaching:

original: aṭṭhahi vā garudhammehi aññena vā dhammena ovadati, āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Atthaṅgate atthaṅgatasaññī ovadati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
analyzed: aṭṭhahi vā garu dhammehi aññena vā dhammena ovadati āpatti pācittiyassa  atthaṅgate atthaṅgata saññī ovadati āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: if he gives a teaching on the eight important principles or any other teaching, he commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If he has not yet set, but he perceives that he has, and he gives a teaching, he commits an offense entailing confession.
If he has not yet set, but he is unsure of it, and he gives a teaching, he commits an offense entailing confession.

analyzed: atthaṅgate anatthaṅgata saññī ovadati āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: If the other person has not disrobed, but he perceives that she has, and he instructs her, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Ekatoupasampannāya ovadati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Anatthaṅgate atthaṅgatasaññī, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Anatthaṅgate vematiko, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: ekatas upasampannāya ovadati āpatti dukkaṭassa  anatthaṅgate atthaṅgata saññī āpatti dukkaṭassa  anatthaṅgate vematikaḥ āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If he instructs one who is fully ordained only on one side, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If the other person has not disrobed, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
If the other person has not disrobed, and he does not perceive that she has, there is no offense.
There is no offense if🔽he is reciting;

analyzed: osārehi ayya iti vuccamānaḥ osāreti  pañham pucchati
translated: if he is answering a question;🔽if he is asked to explain, and he explains;
if he is asked a question;🔽if he is answering a question;
if the nuns listen to him speaking for the benefit of someone else;
if it is a trainee nun;🔽if it is a novice nun;
if he is insane;
if he is the first offender.🔽The training rule on disrobed, the second, is finished.
